t: Isaiah 45
Cyrus, God’s Instrument

“Thus*pn says the Lord*s to His anointed, To*ld Cyrus, whose right hand I have held— To*ld subdue nations before him And*ld loose the armor of kings, To*ld open before him the double doors, So*ld that the gates will not be shut:
‘I*ld will go before you And*ld make the crooked places straight; I*ld will break in pieces the gates of bronze And*ld cut the bars of iron.
I*ld will give you the treasures of darkness And*ld hidden riches of secret places, That*ld you may know that I, the Lord,*s Who*ld call you*i by your name, Am*ild the God of Israel.
For*ld Jacob My servant’s sake, And*ld Israel My elect, I*ld have even called you by your name; I*ld have named you, though you have not known Me.
I*ld am*i the Lord,*s and there*i is*i no other; There*ild is*i no God besides Me. I*ld will gird you, though you have not known Me,
That*ld they may know from the rising of the sun to its setting That*ld there*i is*i none besides Me. I*ld am*i the Lord,*s and there*i is*i no other;
I*ld form the light and create darkness, I*ld make peace and create calamity; I,*ld the Lord,*s do all these things.’*i

“Rain*ln down, you heavens, from above, And*ld let the skies pour down righteousness; Let*ld the earth open, let them bring forth salvation, And*ld let righteousness spring up together. I,*ld the Lord,*s have created it.

“Woe*ln to him who strives with his Maker! Let*ild the potsherd strive*i with the potsherds of the earth! Shall*ld the clay say to him who forms it, ‘What are you making?’ Or*ld shall your handiwork say,*i ‘He has no hands’?
Woe*ld to him who says to his*i father, ‘What are you begetting?’ Or*ld to the woman, ‘What have you brought forth?’”
Thus*ln says the Lord,*s The*ld Holy One of Israel, and his Maker: “Ask*ld Me of things to come concerning My sons; And*ld concerning the work of My hands, you command Me.
I*ld have made the earth, And*ld created man on it. I—My*ld hands—stretched out the heavens, And*ld all their host I have commanded.
I*ld have raised him up in righteousness, And*ld I will direct all his ways; He*ld shall build My city And*ld let My exiles go free, Not*ld for price nor reward,” Says*ld the Lord*s of hosts.
The Lord, the Only Savior

Thus*p says the Lord:*s “The*pn labor of Egypt and merchandise of Cush And*ld of the Sabeans, men of stature, Shall*ld come over to you, and they shall be yours; They*ld shall walk behind you, They*ld shall come over in chains; And*ld they shall bow down to you. They*ld will make supplication to you, saying,*i ‘Surely God is*i in you, And*ld there*i is*i no other; There*ild is*i no other God.’”
Truly*ld You are*i God, who hide Yourself, O*ld God of Israel, the Savior!
They*ld shall be ashamed And*ld also disgraced, all of them; They*ld shall go in confusion together, Who*ild are*i makers of idols.
But*ild Israel shall be saved by the Lord*s With*ld an everlasting salvation; You*ld shall not be ashamed or disgraced Forever*ld and ever.

For*ln thus says the Lord,*s Who*ld created the heavens, Who*ld is God, Who*ld formed the earth and made it, Who*ld has established it, Who*ld did not create it in vain, Who*ld formed it to be inhabited: “I*ld am*i the Lord,*s and there*i is*i no other.

I*ld have not spoken in secret, In*ld a dark place of the earth; I*ld did not say to the seed of Jacob, ‘Seek*ld Me in vain’; I,*ld the Lord,*s speak righteousness, I*ld declare things that are right.

“Assemble*ln yourselves and come; Draw*ld near together, You*ld who*i have*i escaped from the nations. They*ld have no knowledge, Who*ld carry the wood of their carved image, And*ld pray to a god that*i cannot save.

Tell*ld and bring forth your*i case;*i Yes,*ld let them take counsel together. Who*ld has declared this from ancient time? Who*ild has told it from that time? Have*ild not I, the Lord?*s And*ld there*i is*i no other God besides Me, A*ld just God and a Savior; There*ild is*i none besides Me.
“Look*ln to Me, and be saved, All*ld you ends of the earth! For*ld I am*i God, and there*i is*i no other.
I*ld have sworn by Myself; The*ld word has gone out of My mouth in*i righteousness, And*ld shall not return, That*ld to Me every knee shall bow, Every*ld tongue shall take an oath.
He*ld shall say, ‘Surely*ld in the Lord*s I have righteousness and strength. To*ld Him men*i shall come, And*ld all shall be ashamed Who*ld are incensed against Him.
In*ld the Lord*s all the descendants of Israel Shall*ld be justified, and shall glory.’”
